paper.title: MODELLING CONDITIONAL VOLATILITY IN STOCK INDICES: A COMPARISON OF THE ARMA-EGARCH MODEL VERSUS NEURONAL NETWORK BACKPROPAGATION
paper.abstract: The analysis of conditional volatility is a key factor to correctly assess the risk of several financial assets such as shares, bonds or index as well as derivatives (futures and options). The econometric models from the GARCH family are traditionally the most widely used to predict conditional volatility. As an alternative to the econometric models, neural networks can be employed to this end. This paper compares the econometric model ARMA-EGARCH with the neuronal network Backpropagation. Both methodologies have been applied on diverse international stock indices. The main conclusion to be stressed is that the neuronal network can significantly better predict conditional volatility than the econometric model.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用ARMA-EGARCH模型和神经网络Backpropagation来预测股票指数的条件波动性，这直接关系到金融风险管理中的风险测量和预测。
